messages.message:
hey team, i am not sure if this is the right channel.
I deployed a new sandbox & disabled the Authenticator App authentication.
When login with different account, it still pop ups during the login process

Sandbox: https://axa-belgium-pov.internal.instabase.com/apps/admin/users
Version: 23.04.21
Creds: name: <mailto:raul.maechler+support@instabase.com|raul.maechler+support@instabase.com> pw: axa-belgium

I can't log in since TOTP is enabled. Is this a SaaS sandbox? If so, we require TOTP to be enabled and there's no way to disable this unless you toggle the env var.
We noticed the bug that users can see the "None" option in the "Change Security" dialog and that's fixed 2 weeks ago
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/43888
@Xindi Xu yes, saas. So no way to disable it? I wanted to use a user for multiple people

TOTP is required for SaaS for security purposes. We can disable this by entering patches but not sure if that's what we want...
cc @hannah
No - all saas sandboxes that maintain customer data should have TOTP enabled.
We shouldn't override it through patches. @Raul Mächler we should either (i) set up individual accounts or (ii) you can put TOTP into 1password.
